isSecure(java.net.Socket).Description: Checks whether a socket connection is secure. This factory creates plain socket connections which are not considered secure.

Returns: iff the argument is this object
equals(java.lang.Object).Description: Compares this factory with an object. There is only one instance of this class.

createSocket().Description: Creates a new, unconnected socket. The socket should subsequently be passed to @B_org#apache#http#conn#scheme#SocketFactory#connectSocket_E@.

Returns: the one and only plain socket factory
getSocketFactory().Description: Gets the singleton instance of this class.

Returns: the connected socket. The returned object may be different from the sock argument if this factory supports a layered protocol.
Parameters: the socket to connect, as obtained from @B_org#apache#http#conn#scheme#PlainSocketFactory#createSocket_E@. null indicates that a new socket should be created and connected.
the port to connect to on the host
the local address to bind the socket to, or null for any
the port on the local machine, 0 or a negative number for any
connectSocket(java.net.Socket, java.lang.Description: Connects a socket to the given host.
connectSocket(java.net.Socket, java.lang.FullName: public Socket connectSocket (Socket sock, String host, int port, InetAddress localAddress, int localPort, HttpParams params)

hashCode().Description: Obtains a hash code for this object. All instances of this class have the same hash code. There is only one instance of this class.
